en: sound of cloth ripping or rain beating down
that one there (distant demonstrative pronoun referring to class 1 and 3 nouns)
that ... there (distant demonstrative adjective referring to class 1 and 3 nouns)
This field is bigger than that one.
yours (second person singular possessive pronoun referring back to class 1 nouns)
your (second person singular possessive adjective modifying class 1 nouns)
your (second person plural emphatic possessive adjective modifying class 1 nouns)
for you (second person plural possessive object pronoun referring back to class 1 nouns)

ngiemboon: Gʉa na ngáb gi, ńgwoon gẅi.
en: Among the chickens there, stop yours.
yours (second person singular possessive pronoun referring back to class 3 nouns)
your (second person singular possessive adjective modifying class 3 nouns)
your (second person plural emphatic possessive adjective modifying class 3 nouns)
for you (second person plural possessive object pronoun referring back to class 3 nouns)

ngiemboon: Nkáʼ wég wɔɔn, é gẅí gwɔ́.
en: Here is our field, where is yours.
who (relative pronoun modifying class 1 and 3 nouns)

ngiemboon: Tóo ḿbí nkẅíŋ gẅie é nuŋe jʉʼɔɔn lɔɔn ńdɔg ńgʉa.
en: Come and take the wood that is here to leave.

ngiemboon: Á zɛ́tè megẅǐɛ mentá tá mmo yɔɔn poŋ.
en: It takes three steps for this thing to succeed.
